page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY(CONT)
page.content: During the Civil Wars a battle was fought at Torrington. One Langtree man, Major John Fraine, killed in the battle was buried in Langtree Church where a memorial records his death. During the 18th & 19th Centuries the population rose as agriculture thrived in the area. During the 19th Century Bible Christian Chapels were built in the village, and a Church School which held 130 children. In 1929 the original school was replaced by the present building which now has 63 pupils. Most land of the parish is now owned by individual landowners since the Clinton family who succeeded the Rolles were forced to sell much of their estates in the 1950's.
